title: What is your opinion on Joe Biden's statement while visiting Kenosha that 'a black man invented the light bulb, not a white guy named Edison'? - Quora
tags: History of the United States of America
Politics of the United States of America

response.answer_text: I think Joe Biden wouldn’t know what day it was. I did google this and this is was attributed to Biden: “classes? A black man invented the light bulb. not a white guy named Edison. Okay? There's so much. Did anybody know?" Joe Biden: Why Don't We Teach History? "A Black Man Invented The Lightbulb, Not A White Guy Named Edison" A black man L H Latimer was indeed importantly involved in improving the light bulb. See: “Latimer received a patent on January 17, 1882 for the "Process of Manufacturing Carbons", an improved method for the production of lightbulb carbon filaments. The Edison Electric Light Company in New York City hired Latimer in 1884, as a draftsman and an expert witness in patent litigation on electric lights. While at Edison, Latimer wrote the first book on electric lighting, Incandescent Electric Lighting (1890)” Lewis Howard Latimer - Wikipedia Latimer was indeed seriously involved in improving the light bulb. But he did not invent it. There were patents for light bulbs decades before Latimer and Edison lodged their own applications. See: “Historians Robert Friedel and Paul Israel list 22 inventors of incandescent lamps prior to Joseph Swanand Thomas Edison. They conclude that Edison's version was able to outstrip the others because of a combination of three factors: an effective incandescentmaterial, a higher vacuum than others were able to achieve (by use of the Sprengel pump) and a high resistance that made power distribution from a centralized source economically viable.” Incandescent light bulb - Wikipedia So old SleepyJoe is rewriting history yet again.

I haven’t heard that claim. I suspect that he’s overstating a genuine event for the purposes of appealing to his audience. Here’s the thing, the light bulb (like many inventions in history), don’t have as clear an individual inventor, despite our desires to make it so. Thomas Edison didn’t invent the light bulb, he invented a better light bulb than what was currently on the market. (In point of fact, he oversaw a company that invented a better light bulb. He loved to sell the ‘lone genius’ myth around himself, but he was a CEO more than he was an inventor). There were electric lights going back to the 1830’s, there were commercially available light bulbs years before Edison came out with his. And then people after him invented improved versions. I’m guessing that there was, somewhere in the early days, a black inventor who created a better version of the light bulb, and we could choose to draw the line there any say that he “invented” the light bulb. And that claim would probably not be much less plausible than giving the credit to Edison. It’s not an unbiased analysis of history, it’s certainly pandering, but I doubt he was saying it without basis.
